verses.text_plain: Now Sarai Abram’s wife bare him no children: and she had an handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
verses.verse_html: 1Now Sarai Abram’s wife bare him no children: and she had an handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

verses.text_plain: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the Lord hath restrained me from bearing: I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
verses.verse_html:
2And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the Lord hath restrained me from bearing: I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai. ▼
▼ obtain…: Heb. be built by her

tokens.text: be that I may obtain children

footnotes.body_text: ▼ obtain…: Heb. be built by her
footnotes.body_html: ▼ obtain…: Heb. be built by her

verses.text_plain: And Sarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.
verses.verse_html: 3And Sarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.

verses.text_plain: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
verses.verse_html: 4And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.

verses.text_plain: And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee: I have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: the Lord judge between me and thee.
verses.verse_html: 5And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong be upon thee: I have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: the Lord judge between me and thee.

verses.text_plain: But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. And when Sarai dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face.
verses.verse_html:
6But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. And when Sarai dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face. ▼
▼ as…: Heb. that which is good in thine eyes
 , ▼
▼ dealt…: Heb. afflicted her

tokens.text: to her as it pleaseth thee

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as…: Heb. that which is good in thine eyes
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as…: Heb. that which is good in thine eyes
▼ dealt…: Heb. afflicted her

verses.text_plain: And the angel of the Lord found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.
verses.verse_html: 7And the angel of the Lord found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.
verses.verse_html: 8And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.

verses.text_plain: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands.
verses.verse_html: 9And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands.

verses.text_plain: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
verses.verse_html: 10And the angel of the Lord said unto her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.

tokens.text: that it shall not be numbered

verses.text_plain: And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the Lord hath heard thy affliction.
verses.verse_html:
11And the angel of the Lord said unto her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the Lord hath heard thy affliction. ▼
▼ Ishmael: that is, God shall hear

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Ishmael: that is, God shall hear
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Ishmael: that is, God shall hear

verses.text_plain: And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man’s hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.
verses.verse_html: 12And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man’s hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.

tokens.text: And he will be a wild
against every man, and every man’s hand
against him; and he shall dwell

verses.text_plain: And she called the name of the Lord that spake unto her, Thou God seest me: for she said, Have I also here looked after him that seeth me?
verses.verse_html: 13And she called the name of the Lord that spake unto her, Thou God seest me: for she said, Have I also here looked after him that seeth me?

verses.text_plain: Wherefore the well was called Beer–lahai–roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.verse_html:
14Wherefore the well was called Beer–lahai–roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered. ▼
▼ Beer–lahai–roi: that is, The well of him that liveth and seeth me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Beer–lahai–roi: that is, The well of him that liveth and seeth me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Beer–lahai–roi: that is, The well of him that liveth and seeth me

verses.text_plain: And Hagar bare Abram a son: and Abram called his son’s name, which Hagar bare, Ishmael.
verses.verse_html: 15And Hagar bare Abram a son: and Abram called his son’s name, which Hagar bare, Ishmael.

verses.text_plain: And Abram was fourscore and six years old, when Hagar bare Ishmael to Abram.
verses.verse_html: 16And Abram was fourscore and six years old, when Hagar bare Ishmael to Abram.
